item.title: Breaking: SEC Takes Aim At Binance’s Ex-CCO For Willful Violation Of US Regulations | Coingape
item.dc:creator: Coingape Staff
item.description:
In a civil suit filed in Washington D.C.’s federal court, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has accused Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, of operating as a thinly-veiled shell game. The lawsuit alleges that Binance’s founder, Changpeng Zhao, and its then Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) used customer accounts for personal gain while evading U.S.

item.title: Bitcoin, Crypto Under Selloff Pressure As US Treasury Dept Start Issuing T-Bills | Coingape
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
The U.S. Treasury Department didn’t wait long enough after the debt ceiling deal and decided to start offering Treasury bills immediately. The US Treasury to auction $173 billion in short-term Treasury bills on June 5 to start rebuilding its depleted cash balance, with $1 trillion in T-bills expected by the end of the third quarter.

The post Bitcoin, Crypto Under Selloff Pressure As US Treasury Dept Start Issuing T-Bills appeared first on CoinGape.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Treasury Department didn’t wait long enough after the debt ceiling deal and decided to start offering Treasury bills immediately. The US Treasury to auction $173 billion in short-term Treasury bills on June 5 to start rebuilding its depleted cash balance, with $1 trillion in T-bills expected by the end of the third quarter.

The post Bitcoin, Crypto Under Selloff Pressure As US Treasury Dept Start Issuing T-Bills appeared first on CoinGape.
